data.title: The Austro-Hungarian Empire. Make sense of it for Your Genealogy. — Project Ancestry - Austria
data.meta_description: The Austro-Hungarian Empire is confusing.  Why did your ancestor’s say they were Austrian?
data.text:
Let the confusion begin

The Austro-Hungarian Empire can be really confusing.

Let’s say your ancestor, born in 1905, referred to themselves as Austrian - even on official documents - and the family story has always been that they were indeed Austrian.

Then, on starting your family tree - you discover that they were born in Trieste, Italy.

So, were they Austrian or Italian? Where should you be searching for records, Austria or Italy?

Austro-Hungarian Monarchy

Österreichisch-Ungarische Monarchie / k.u.k Monarchie

Osztrák–Magyar Monarchia

Why say you were Austrian, when you kind of weren’t?

Well they kind of were Austrian.

It was common to label yourself ‘Austrian’ when in reality - they were referring to theentire Empire. In simple terms - where they lived was located in an ‘Austrian part’ of the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

For example, your ancestor’s:

Documents and records show them as Austrian but at the time it was Slovenia.

Documents and records show them as Austrian but at the time it was current-day Italy.

Nationality on documents

Nationality may have been recorded as: Austrian or Austro-Hungarian or Hungarian.

Take note: As the Austro-Hungarian Empire dissolved, the records remained in the new country and that’s where you need to be researching.
